Statistics for DEA Results Based Golden Standards

pip.statistics.Rd

Computing the true positive rate, false postive rate, false discovery rate, and false negative rate based on given golden standards.

pip.statistics(
  raw,
  groups,
  norm.method,
  RUV_method = NULL,
  QN_filter = FALSE,
  DE.method = "DE.voom",
  Pval = 0.01,
  truth,
  marker_selection = FALSE,
  selected_marker = NULL
)

Arguments

raw

raw count data in the format of data frame or matrix, with columns for samples and raws for genes.
groups

vector of characters indicating the group for each sample (only 2 groups allowed).
norm.method

the method for normalization selected from norm.none, norm.TMM, norm.TC, norm.UQ, norm.med, norm.DESeq, norm.PoissonSeq, norm.QN, norm.SVA, and norm.RUV.
RUV_method

the exact RUV method used from RUVg, RUVr and RUVs if method = norm.RUV
QN_filter

whether the filtering is performed if method = norm.QN.
DE.method

the method for differential expression analysis from DE.voom and DE.edgeR, default to be DE.voom.
Pval

p-value for identifying DE genes, default to be 0.01
truth

vector of genes that are truly differential expressed
marker_selection

whether selecting a subset of genes/markers for this analysis
selected_marker

vector of a subset of genes/markers for this analysis

Value

a list of values about TPR, FPR, FDR, FNR

Examples

truthgene <- DE.voom(data.benchmark, data.group)$id.list
stat <- pip.statistics(data.test, data.group, "norm.TMM", truth = truthgene)
